column4: how do i get core 2 duo cpu multicore support working under Edgy?
edgy  supports multicore out of da box
just did a cat/cpuinfo, only shows 1 cpu
386 kernel is not for new machines - perhaps it has no multiprocessor support
you should be running a 686 kernel and sorting your nvidia problems like that
Linux homebox 2.6.17-11-generic #2 SMP Thu Feb 1 19:52:28 UTC 2007 i686 GNU/Linux
whats Linux homebox 2.6.17-11-generic / mybox kernels designed for?
do a uname -a in a console
you may possibly have to live with 1 processor core
686/generic is for modern day machines - you should be using it
Ok, will reboot now, I assume after reboot to-generic i have to re-install nvidia-glx...correct?
I take it you are trying for a 3d desktop?
